quest.name: Bearing with It
journal: Y'shtola wears a haunted expression, Emet-Selch's words having clearly found their mark.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text:
The eldest and most powerful of primals... Gods. If that were Hydaelyn's origin, then what would that make─
...No. No, I will not take the words of an Ascian on trust. It has to be a lie.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thancred did tell me about primals...but I don't fully understand what all of this means.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis oft said truth is a matter of perspective. Yet upon this matter, there can be but one truth. I only pray it is not his.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Forename, you are returned! But...something troubles you. Is aught amiss?

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: What has happened to the sky!? I have never seen anything like it!

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: The sky, it...it is beautiful.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though recent events plainly warrant further discussion, I think it best that we wait until Alphinaud and the others are present.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Emet-Selch included. How convenient that he should choose this moment to keep to the shadows.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well...no matter. For the present, we should return to Fanow and make certain of the Eulmorans' withdrawal.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: After that, Slitherbough. The Blessed are no doubt elated by what has become of the sky.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: You are returned. And unharmed, I see.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Indeed. I am pleased to report that the Lightwarden is no more, thanks in large part to you.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: That the death of a single sin eater should make such a difference...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: As our numbers waned, so too did our hope that the ruins we have devoted our lives to guarding would ever find purpose.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Yet here you are, the allies for whom we have waited these many centuries. And with your arrival came the chance to pass on our legacy─the ancient wisdom of the empire.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: That alone would have been reward enough... Never did we imagine it would serve to banish the Light that pervaded these woods.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: On behalf of the Viis, our forebears, and the late emperor of Ronka, you have our deepest thanks.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is we who should be thanking you. Our journey through the Qitana Ravel proved...most enlightening.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To be privy to such knowledge is an honor. One for which we never hoped...

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Please, you need not be so humble!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We but do our duty as decreed by the late emperor. Would that he were still with us to express his gratitude in person.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: But Sister, does this not mean our duty is fulfilled?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: To our allies, perhaps, but the ruins cannot be left unguarded.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: So long as we live here in these woods, the secrets of Ronka must not fall into the wrong hands.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Is Runar still here?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: No, we escorted him back to Slitherbough shortly after you set out.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: If you would return to the Night's Blessed, we will not keep you any longer. I suspect they would be glad of your company.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Almet. I look forward to a day when we might share a more leisurely visit to the ruins of Ronka.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We will await your return, then.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Should you have need of the wisdom of Ronka again, you know where to find us.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: Be it a year from now or ten, we look forward to your return.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Perhaps someday we will visit your home instead.
